profile_positions.title: Public Health Advisor - Health & Immunization Systems Strengthening

profile_positions.description: Overall responsible for the technical guidance to and the managerial aspects of the technical teams in HQ-New York, the 6 regional offices and the country offices in the area of immunization and immunization systems strengthening. Represent the Immunization unit in the health section and beyond in UNICEF as well as externally with the key partner organizations like WHO, CDC, WB, GAVI and BMGF. I lead the team in the development of a budgeted multiyear plan and annual work plans and ensure their implementation and operationalization as well as monitoring.  In this ad interim position I remain to a great extend responsible for the functions as senior immunization advisor.
profile_positions.title: Chief Immunization a.i.

profile_positions.description: In this 2 pronged position, I coordinate the global UNICEF-WHO-GAVI business plan which defines a broad set of inputs, quarterly deliverables joint annual results. This plan is implemented in a set of priority countries in Africa and SE Asia. Furthermore I lead the coordination and implementation of technical assistance to countries in their Health Systems Strengthening (HSS) endeavors and projects. Specifically the GAVI-HSS for Immunization Outcomes grant applications, their implementation and monitoring at global as well as country level. India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Laos, Myanmar and Kenya are example countries. In these and many other countries, UNICEF supports health systems strengthening in close collaboration with WHO and UNICEF. Since June 2015 I have been appointed Chief of the Immunization Unit a.i. and lead the whole unit until a new leader is found and appointed. This will involve providing leadership and technical guidance to the various work streams of the unit like Immunization Supply Chain and Logistics Management, Immunization financing, Coverage & Equity, Demand creation and social mobilization, Measles & Rubella and Polio legacy for Routine Immunization strengthening.
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor Immunization and Health Systems Strenghtening

profile_positions.description:
Overall responsible for the planning, human resources & financial management, implementation and monitoring & evaluation of the subsection health in the 5 year Country Programme Action Plan. This included advising and guiding the teams in the 13 state offices where a chief of office manages the different sections of the UNICEF program. I lead a team of over 30 UNICEF professionals and several seconded consultants and support staff. I interacted on an almost daily basis with the top level leadership of the Ministry of Health and regular with the Departments of Health in the States. I represented UNICEF at various forums, seminars, congresses and consultations. I participated in knowledge management with my colleagues in the region and in New York HQ.
Support to the large flagship programs of India like National Rural Health Mission and Reproductive and Child Health II comprises among other of comprehensive support Programs and projects in Cold Chain, Routine Immunization, Measles campaigns, capacity building of front line health workers as well as mid-level health managers, “Integrated Management of Child and Neonatal Illnesses (IMNCI), Skilled Birth Attendance (SBA), Young Child Survival and Development Programs and several more. There is an intense cooperation between the “Polio section” and the “Health section” at the country office level as well at state level, especially in Uttar Pradesh and Bihar where the 107 High Risk Block plan is under implementation. Convergence in the areas of Diarrhea prevention & control, early and exclusive Breast Feeding and sanitation are key in this plan. 
We operated within various partnerships with WHO, DfID, IKEA, Norwegian Government, Public Health foundation of India, India Academy of Pediatrics and many more academic and research institutions.
